medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in her usual state of good health until 3 months before admission, when fatigue and general unsteadiness developed. Two months before admission, episodes of worsening unsteadiness occurred. Four weeks before admission, progressive gait imbalance developed, requiring the use of a cane for assistance outside. Two weeks before admission, sudden involuntary movements of the arms and loss of positional awareness occurred. The patient also reported new blurry vision, insomnia, and a constant mild headache.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hyperlipidemia, impaired glucose tolerance, asthma, and mild hearing loss.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had hypertension; father died from lung cancer. Brother and two adult children were healthy. No family history of ataxia, dementia, autoimmune disease, or neurodegenerative disease.
medical_history.social_history: Retired educator who lived with her husband. Previously active, participating in daily aerobics, yoga, and dance classes. Consumption of one glass of wine nightly, which she stopped when symptoms began. No smoking or illicit drug use.
